HTMLTableRowElement.summary: The HTMLTableRowElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond the interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of rows in an HTML table.

remarks.para: -The HTML element implementing this interface: tr.

HTMLTableRowElementAlign.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The align property of the interface is a string indicating how to horizontally align text in the {{htmlelement("tr")}} table row. Individual cells can override it.

blockquote.para: This property is deprecated, and CSS should be used to align text horizontally in a cell. Use the CSS text-align property, which takes precedence, to horizontally align text in a row instead.

HTMLTableRowElementBgColor.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The HTMLTableRowElement.bgColor property is used to set the background color of a row or retrieve the value of the obsolete bgColor attribute, if present.

blockquote.para: This property is deprecated and CSS should be used to set the background color. Use the background-color property instead.

HTMLTableRowElementBgColor.value:
One of the following value types can be used:
NOTEThe values accepted here are a subset of the CSS color values. You can reuse HTML color values in CSS, but not in the other direction: the unknown colors would appear differently than expected.

HTMLTableRowElementCells.summary:
The cells read-only property of the interface
returns a live containing the cells in the row. The HTMLCollection is live and is automatically updated when cells are added or removed.

HTMLTableRowElementCh.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The ch property of the interface does nothing. It reflects the char attribute of the tr element.

blockquote.para: This property was designed to participate to the ability to align table cell content on a specific character (typically the decimal point), but was never implemented by browsers.
To achieve such alignment, watch for the support of a string value with the text-align CSS property.

HTMLTableRowElementChOff.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The chOff property of the interface does nothing. It reflects the charoff attribute of the tr element.

blockquote.para: This property was designed to participate in an ability to align table cell content on a specific character (typically the decimal point), but was never implemented by browsers.
To achieve such alignment, watch for the support of a string value with the text-align CSS property.

HTMLTableRowElementDeleteCell.summary:
The deleteCell() method of the interface removes a
specific row cell from a given tr.

HTMLTableRowElementInsertCell.summary:
The insertCell() method of the interface inserts a new
cell (td) into a table row (tr) and returns a
reference to the cell.

blockquote.para:
insertCell() inserts the cell directly into the
row. The cell does not need to be appended separately
with as would be the case if
had been used to create the new
<td> element.

You can not use insertCell() to create a new <th>
element though.

HTMLTableRowElementInsertCell.returns:
An that references the new
cell.

HTMLTableRowElementRowIndex.summary:
The rowIndex read-only property of the interface
represents the position of a row within the whole table.

remarks.para:
Even when the thead, tbody, and
tfoot elements are out of order in the HTML, browsers render the
table in the right order. Therefore the rows count from <thead> to
<tbody>, from <tbody> to
<tfoot>.

HTMLTableRowElementRowIndex.value: The index of the row, or -1 if the row is not part of a table.

HTMLTableRowElementSectionRowIndex.summary:
The sectionRowIndex read-only property of the interface
represents the position of a row within the current section (thead, tbody, or tfoot).
HTMLTableRowElementSectionRowIndex.value: The index of the row, or -1 if the row is not part of the section.

HTMLTableRowElementVAlign.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The vAlign property of the interface is a string indicating how to vertically align text in a {{htmlelement("tr")}} table row. Individual cells can override it.

blockquote.para: This property is deprecated. Use the CSS vertical-align property to horizontally align text in a row instead.
